topic.title: Stress, Coping, and Burnout in Healthcare

body.text: Working in health-care settings often means facing time pressure, high stakes, and emotionally charged encounters. When environmental demands feel severe enough to exceed an individual's resources, the result is psychological stress. Two main neuro-endocrine systems are activated: the sympatho-adreno-medullary (SAM) axis, releasing adrenaline and noradrenaline for an immediate "fight-or-flight" response, and the hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal (HPA) axis, culminating in cortisol secretion that sustains energy supply but, when chronic, impairs immunity and mood.

According to Lazarus and Folkman's transactional model, an event causes stress only if it is appraised as threatening and coping resources are judged inadequate. Coping strategies can be broadly grouped into problem-focused approaches that change the stressor, emotion-focused approaches that regulate the emotional response, and maladaptive or avoidant strategies that provide short-term relief at the cost of long-term functioning.

items: Problem-focused: setting action plans, managing time, and creating checklists to address the stressor directly.
Emotion-focused: mindfulness, breathing exercises, reframing, and other practices that regulate feelings.
Maladaptive: disengaging, venting without action, or ignoring deadlines, which may worsen outcomes over time.

questions.title: Hormonal mediator of prolonged stress
questions.stem: Which hormone is the primary long-acting mediator released via the HPA axis during a stress response?
questions.explanation: Cortisol is released from the adrenal cortex via the HPA axis and sustains the physiological stress response during ongoing threats.

questions.title: Example of problem-focused coping
questions.stem: Which of the following behaviours best illustrates problem-focused coping?
choices: Emotional disclosure after a difficult shift
Designing a detailed study timetable to cover upcoming exam topics
questions.explanation: Problem-focused coping targets the stressor itself; creating a detailed timetable is an action plan to manage workload demands.

questions.title: Maslach burnout triad check
questions.stem: Which option is NOT part of the classic Maslach triad used to define professional burnout?
questions.explanation: The Maslach triad includes emotional exhaustion, depersonalization, and reduced personal accomplishment; increased empathy is not one of the defining domains.

questions.title: Drivers of depersonalization
questions.stem: In hospital residents, which workplace factor is most closely linked to the development of depersonalization?

questions.title: Classifying mindful breathing
questions.stem: Practising five minutes of mindful breathing between patient encounters is best categorised as:

choices.label: B
choices.text: Thin descending limb of the loop of Henle

choices.label: C
choices.text: Thick ascending limb of the loop of Henle

questions.explanation: The proximal convoluted tubule reabsorbs the majority of filtered sodium, water, glucose, and amino acids through its leaky tight junctions, making it the best match for this description.

questions.title: True statement about acute stress
questions.stem: Which statement about acute stress is true?
questions.explanation: The elevated PaCO2 with an acidic pH and near-normal bicarbonate is most consistent with a primary respiratory acidosis due to hypoventilation.
